Table of Contents

Class Sig

Namespace
OpenForge.Cryptography.LibOqs.SIG
Assembly
OpenForge.Cryptography.LibOqs.SIG.dll

High-level wrapper for LibOQS digital signature operations. This class provides a user-friendly interface for post-quantum digital signature operations. Digital signatures provide authentication, integrity, and non-repudiation.

public sealed class Sig : IDisposable

object

Constructors

Sig(string)

Initializes a new instance of the Signature class with the specified algorithm.

public Sig(string algorithmName)

Parameters

algorithmName string

The name of the digital signature algorithm to use.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if algorithmName is null.

NotSupportedException

Thrown if the algorithm is not supported or enabled.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the signature instance could not be created.

Properties

AlgorithmName

Gets the name of the digital signature algorithm used by this instance.

public string AlgorithmName { get; }

Property Value

string

The algorithm identifier string.

ClaimedNistLevel

Gets the NIST security level claimed by this signature algorithm.

public byte ClaimedNistLevel { get; }

Property Value

byte

The NIST security level (1, 2, 3, or 5).

IsEufCma

Gets a value indicating whether this signature algorithm provides EUF-CMA security. EUF-CMA (Existential Unforgeability under Chosen Message Attack) is the standard security requirement for signatures.

public bool IsEufCma { get; }

Property Value

bool

True if the algorithm provides EUF-CMA security, false otherwise.

PublicKeyLength

Gets the length of public keys in bytes for this signature algorithm.

public int PublicKeyLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The public key length in bytes.

SecretKeyLength

Gets the length of secret keys in bytes for this signature algorithm.

public int SecretKeyLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The secret key length in bytes.

SignatureLength

Gets the maximum length of signatures in bytes for this signature algorithm.

public int SignatureLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The signature length in bytes.

Methods

Dispose()

Disposes the signature instance and releases all associated resources. After disposal, this instance cannot be used for further operations.

public void Dispose()

GenerateKeyPair()

Generates a new cryptographic key pair for this signature algorithm. The secret key should be kept private and securely stored.

public (byte[] publicKey, byte[] secretKey) GenerateKeyPair()

Returns

(byte[] publicKey, byte[] secretKey)

A tuple containing the public key and secret key as byte arrays.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

Thrown if this instance has been disposed.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if key pair generation fails.

GetSupportedAlgorithms()

Gets all digital signature algorithms that are currently supported and enabled in LibOQS.

public static string[] GetSupportedAlgorithms()

Returns

string[]

An array of algorithm identifier strings for supported signature algorithms.

IsAlgorithmSupported(string)

Determines whether a specific digital signature algorithm is supported and available for use.

public static bool IsAlgorithmSupported(string algorithmName)

Parameters

algorithmName string

The name of the signature algorithm to check.

Returns

bool

True if the algorithm is supported and enabled, false otherwise.

Sign(byte[], byte[])

Signs a message using the provided secret key, creating a digital signature. The signature can be verified using the corresponding public key.

public byte[] Sign(byte[] message, byte[] secretKey)

Parameters

message byte[]

The message to sign.

secretKey byte[]

The secret key for signing.

Returns

byte[]

The digital signature bytes.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

Thrown if this instance has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if message or secretKey is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if the secret key has an invalid length.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if signing fails.

Verify(byte[], byte[], byte[])

Verifies a digital signature against the original message using the signer's public key.

public bool Verify(byte[] message, byte[] signature, byte[] publicKey)

Parameters

message byte[]

The original message that was signed.

signature byte[]

The signature to verify.

publicKey byte[]

The public key for verification.

Returns

bool

True if the signature is valid for the message and public key, false otherwise.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

Thrown if this instance has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if any parameter is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if the public key has an invalid length.
